physical measurement but also the cooperation of humanity and social science to account for the diversity of soundscapes across country and culture , with more focus on how people actually experience aesthetic , it has become de rigueur to leverage Aldo Leopold 's legacy against the proliferation of `` popular '' landscape taste , which are typically seen to have their origin in 17th-19th century European tradition of landscape painting and aesthetic .", "These writer regard victim of popular or `` scenic '' landscape taste ( exemplified by Olmsted 's Central Park ) as intellectually shallow , motivated by momentary `` sensory pleasure '' , and passively and anthropocentrically drawn to `` naturalistic '' environment rather than actively and biocentrically engaged with natural environment .", 'This implicit refusal to grant sensory information and affective processing the power to catalyze and inform serious reflection is not new ; neither is the attribution of popular landscape aesthetic to the elite society of a limited culture and historical period surprising , given the current preponderance of post-modernist sensibility .', 'However , in the often highly-charged atmosphere of local environmental planning and management arenas , both position are needlessly polemical .', 'More importantly , there is good evidence to suggest that both position are founded on misconception about how the human mind work .', 'In this paper , we will review work that establishes the intellectual bona fides of visual imagery , the important contribution that emotion make to cognition , and the likelihood that explanation of environmental aesthetic rooted in European enlightenment-era landscape painting are inadequate .', 'This review suggests that frequent call for new normative environmental aesthetic based on a cognitive understanding of ecological sustainability are likely premature .', 'As social scientist , we suggest that attempt to impose prescribed environmental aesthetic ( albeit ecologically pure environmental aesthetic ) are inappropriate and may well be self-defeating .', 'Instead , we suggest that a thorough understanding of visual and non-visual environmental aesthetic is needed , including examination of the possibility that affect elicited by scenic encounter with preferred landscape can lead people to form emotional attachment to the land and thereby develop a greater appreciation for sustainability goal .', "Making friend in Zurich 's urban forest and park : The role of public green space for social inclusion of youth from different culture .", 'Integrating the distinct culture of foreign resident youth is a challenge for Swiss political and educational institution .', 'An empirical survey of pupil ( n = 437 ) and teacher in selected school of the city and metropolitan area of Zurich investigated leisure activity in urban forest and public green space for their potential to facilitate social interaction between Swiss and immigrant young people .', 'Pattern of socialising and making friend in these outdoor location were found to differ depending on age , school level , gender and the percentage of immigrant in each residential area .', 'Public urban green space were found to play an important role for child and youth in making contact and friend across culture , which is considered a prerequisite for social inclusion .', 'Vision of nature and landscape type preference : An exploration in The Netherlands .', "A survey was carried out among inhabitant of Gennep , a small-town municipality in the east of The Netherlands , questioning about ( 1 ) the type of nature that people distinguish and the level of naturalness ascribed to these type of nature ; ( 2 ) the image that people hold of the appropriate relationship between people and nature and the level of adherence to these image , and ( 3 ) people 's preference of broadly defined landscape type .", 'Type of nature inferred by mean of factor analysis were labeled arcadian , wild and penetrative nature , the last category comprising element such as mosquito and rat in the barn .', 'Factor analysis was used as well to infer image of appropriate relationship , which appeared to hinge around the concept of mastery over nature , responsibility for nature and participation in nature , respectively .', "Level of adherence to the responsibility and participation image were very high , indicative of a 'new biophilia ' mainstream in Dutch culture .", "Landscape type were defined , roughly , as ( 1 ) landscape made by and for people ; ( 2 ) park-like , arcadian landscape ; ( 3 ) wild , interactive landscape and ( 4 ) landscape `` in which one may experience the greatness and force of nature '' .", "Strikingly , more than half of the respondent expressed preference for this last ( 'deep ecology ' ) landscape type , with another third preferring the wild , interactive landscape .", "The highest preference of the 'greatness and force ' landscape was found among the respondent with high ascription of naturalness to the penetrative type of nature and respondent adhering to the participation-in-nature image of relationship .", 'Preference for landscape type as defined here should be distinguished from visual or behavioral landscape preference .', "Even if people may not select landscape of the 'greatness 'This fundamental long-term transformation will involve the realignment of urban society ’ s technology and infrastructure , culture and lifestyle , as well as governance and institutional framework .', 'Such structural systemic realignments can be referred to as urban sustainability transition : fundamental and structural change in urban system through which persistent societal challenge are city .', 'The questionnaire comprised 40 question relating to environmental , housing and personal factor .', 'The key question concerned annoyance caused by road traffic noise .', 'The total number another in all direction and on many time-scales .', 'From 2010 to 2050 , the human population is likely to grow bigger , more slowly , older , and more urban .', "It is projected that by 2050 more 2000 , human ' emission of carbon into the atmosphere increased fifteenfold , while the number of people increased less than fourfold .", 'Population growth alone , with constant rate of emission per .', 'Over the last two decade , urban regime theory has become one of the most dominant paradigms of thought in urban study .', 'In particular , regime theory offers a complex account of urban governance , or how local government , the business community , and community organization gain the capacity to shape the policy that affect city , that is , govern .', 'Although regime theory is a dominant theory in urban study , it does , nevertheless , have its share of detractor , and one criticism has been its failure to take into account geographical scale .', 'While there is an acknowledgment in urban regime theory of wider economic process , such as the broad transformation in international and national trade , investment , finance , etc.', ', or the role played by federal or state government , the bias has remained mostly local , particularly in regard to urban governance .', 'In urban regime theory literature the policy and action of international and national institution either nicely conjoin with local interest or are nearly totally absent .', 'Due to this oversight , urban regime theory tends to underemphasize how the capacity to govern a city effectively is sometimes the result of the interaction of action of people at multiple scale .', 'This article attempts to address this oversight in an analysis of Glasgow , Scotland , during the 1980s .', 'By focusing on the role of the European City of Culture in the revitalization of the city , this article demonstrates how the capacity for a ruling coalition to transform the city and to govern effectively was the consequence of the policy and administrative action undertaken at other geographical scale .', 'Aquatic system and water security in the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City church and voluntary agency resort to different understanding of pity in order to acknowledge responsibility for different group of homeless people and shape action in a variety of local setting .', condition in the city have been difficult for the past century due to a number of factor , including : wave of incoming Palestinian refugee of the War of 1948 , and decade of Israeli occupation .', .", 'This article explains this by the high level of agreement on basic beliefs , the shared daily-life practice , the strong shared perception towards external risk and a few common interest , which philosophy has not been well understood yet in the construction industry for the fact that the complexity and dynamic nature of construction project bring up uncertainty that may be hardly handled by construction practitioner .', 'Moreover , project-based nature of construction business makes Lean implementation even more challenging for construction people .', 'Even though Lean effort in construction have recently increased , there are problem with the implementation processes .', 'It is undeniable that successful Lean implementation strongly affects project performance .', 'Therefore , it is essential to reveal enablers and barrier in Lean implementation so that the construction industry practitioner might conduct project more effectively and satisfy project requirement ( i.e .', 'schedule , budget , safety ) .', 'This study aims to provide a set of core enablers and barrier of Lean implementation in construction project and guide construction professional to better satisfy project requirement .', 'Within this context , the study proposes seven major enabler and barrier group , namely the financial , managerial , technical , workforce , culture , government , and communication and twenty-seven component for each group .', 'Moreover , a survey was designed and administered to Lean practitioner to rank the enablers and barrier based on importance level .', barrier in the Lean implementation .', 'However , the average ranking were not found to be diverging indicating that selected component of enabler and barrier group are properly chosen .', 'The study
